@Stephen_Tighe @jhagel I recommend it! A bit technical, but I think it provides several good arguments and theories on how our species, both individuals and groups are fundamentally prospective beings, something futurists have observed, but had too thin psychological foundation to support‚Ä¶

@jhagel But the past only exists in our minds, as do the future. According to psychological research (e g ref book ‚ÄùHomo Prospectus‚Äù) our memories are more shaped to support to our current prospects than we previously have understood. That means that we change the past all the time‚Ä¶

COVID-19 reveals our greatest challenge (and it is not the virus) - it is that scientific and technological development turns every problem they "solve" into a political problem - and the political arenas are not built for managing that. https://t.co/4gZgsssdQT

When our technical capabilities to solve problems increase, our greatest challenge isn‚Äôt the challenges themselves, it is the politics around what to do, how to do it and what to sacrifice. Harari writes in FT about the lessons from COVID19: https://t.co/ZwkPLoOsfP
